Configure Device System Profiles

The system profile for a device includes the configuration for keepalive timer, statistics collection, certificates, and access node logging.

A system profile is applied separately to both a vBBU and its vNodes. Most system profile parameters are shared with the vBBU and vNodes with the exception of Radio Access Technology (RAT) - specific performance monitoring (PMon) interval parameters, which are sent to vNodes only.

  • Create Network Profiles
    A network profile includes the configuration for traffic shaping, Quality of Service (QoS), and QoS statistics collection for both uplink and downlink directions over the HNG.
  • Configure a GSM Profile for Access Nodes
    Use this task to configure a Global System for Mobile communications (GSM) profile for a Converged Wireless System (CWS) access node which performs as a multi-carrier node that can operate as a standalone base station or Remote-Radio Head (RRH) connected to a virtualized Baseband Unit (vBBU)
  • Configure a Cell Statistics Profile
    Use this task to create a statistics monitoring profile necessary for configuring a cell.
  • Configure a Cell Heartbeat Monitoring Profile
    Use this task to create a cell health monitoring profile.
  • Create a System Security Profile
    A system security profile is configured for the access network. Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) is used as a backhaul solution to provide authentication and manage security certificates within a service provider network so that data and voice traffic can be transmitted securely.
  • Configure the System Logging Profile
    Use this task to create a system (2G and 4G) logging profile for troubleshooting and maintaining the PW EMS.
